Looks like the date format may have changed with JIRA 3.8.1.
It seems like we might we swallowing other errors like this, especially those that happens inside background sync job.
Mik, I've added some paranoia to the JiraRepositoryConnector.getChangedSinceLastSync() method. Can you please put a dev build with those chances?
Will cut a dev build this evening.
The stack trace from the description is related to an sorting the attachments table. Eugene, please open a new report for fixing the synchronization issues.
I have committed a fix to use a consistent format for storing dates in task data attributes. As a side effect all JIRA tasks will get marked as having incoming changes on the next synchronization.

(In reply to comment #7)
> I have committed a fix to use a consistent format for storing dates in task
> data attributes. As a side effect all JIRA tasks will get marked as having
> incoming changes on the next synchronization.

Sweet. :-)

I actually don't know if there are synchronization issues with dates. I just added some logging for ignored exceptions and wanted to see if it would appear in the dev build...

Actually hits will only be marked as incoming when manually synchronized since the repository won't report them as changed (so it's not as bad as I first thought).

I think it's good to do more exception reporting for now and remove it if necessary for the final 2.0 release.

(In reply to comment #9)
> I think it's good to do more exception reporting for now and remove it if
> necessary for the final 2.0 release.

Right. Though I am not sure if it is generally a good idea to silently ignore errors like these format issues.
Anyways, Mik punted on dev build last night. Maybe he meant this evening. :-)
Dev build will be available around noon PST today.
